content:
Art. 4.86. 
Ratio in case of substitution, renunciation or unworthiness 
Descendants who come to the succession by way of substitution are bound to reinstate, in that succession, the gifts which they have received from the deceased, unless they have been exempted from doing so.
They are also obliged to report gifts received from the deceased by the person whom they substitute, even if they have renounced the latter's succession, unless such gifts have been exempted from report.
A successor who renounces the succession may, if he or she has no descendants substituting for him or herself, retain the gift or claim the legacy which was granted to him or her, up to the amount of the available portion.
A successor who is unworthy to succeed and who has no descendants substituting for him or her may only retain the gift or claim the legacy granted to him or her up to the amount of the available portion and provided that the gift has not been revoked.
